isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3176 - 1992 - 1993 - DESCRIPTION - ELECTRONIC SERVICE TOOLS

svcprocinfo.para: Electronic service tools are designed to help the service technician locate faults and/or analyze problems within the system. Diagnostic code reading and switch monitoring can be done using the service tools. An electronic service tool is necessary to read or change operating parameters.

svcsubproc.title: Data Link Connector (68)
svcsubproc.para: International provides a Data Link connector (68) for connecting the electronic service tools to the system. The Data Link is located inside the cab on the left kick-panel.

svcsubproc.title: Caterpillar Service Tools
svcsubproc.para: Caterpillar service tools are available. The Electronic Control Analyzer Programmer (ECAP), and the Digital Diagnostic Tool (DDT) both can communicate with the ECM. Refer to Caterpillar Service Manuals for complete information needed to use these tools.

svcsubproc.title: MPSI Pro-Link 9000
svcsubproc.para: The MPSI Pro-Link 9000 Electronic Service Tool is available with a single cartridge that communicates with Caterpillar engines. The Pro-Link 9000 communicates with the engine ECM through the Data Link connector. A manual is provided with the MPSI Caterpillar cartridge explaining its use.

This manual does not discuss engine diagnostics, except as they relate to International installed circuits or components. Refer to the Caterpillar Engine Operators Manual furnished with the vehicle and/or other Caterpillar Service Literature for additional engine related information.

note.para: When referring to electronic service tools, this manual will make reference to the MPSI Pro-Link.
